ygData.subject: Re: OOC: Nic
ygData.msgSnippet: Jerame, I don t think a time limit post is gonna work, purely cause of the time zone difference . I think a more conditional rule needs to be imposed. That is

Jerame, I don't think a time limit post is gonna work,
purely cause of the time zone difference . I think a
more conditional rule needs to be imposed. That is
athat all players in the vicinity of a scene must be
given upto 24 hours to reply to any post. This kills
off two birds with one stone- firstly it stops flood
posting and second it forces people to post every day.

 --- Jerame Johnson <jeramej@...> wrote: > Nic,
I got an Ideal for the posting, How about
> limiting it to like five post a day. I mean that
> might be better. I mean I am soo Confused with the
> ammount of post. I have SBC Yahoo DSL and I got in
> the matter of five minutes like 12 mails from the
> same source. Man it's gotta stop. I have schoool and
> work . It takes up most of my time right now and
> when I check out my post then I got like 40+ post in
> my inbox. And it like blows. I am bout ready to walk
> away from this game.
> 
> Nic, I think the flood posting thing has gotten
> beyond
> the point of discussion, with the current modding
> going on (at the risk of pointing fingers, airly and
> shadowess agoth are by far the worst offenders at
> this), how the heck am I meant to get a fair chance
> to
> reply to posts. I think you need to set a ruling in
> stone on this because it's clear that discussion is
> pointless with the nothing coming of it. I think a
> rule needs to be set that if a player is not given a
> fair chance to reply, then any posts beyond the
> point
> of a realistic reply (as in anything that would
> exceed
> time periods where characters reply if the situation
> were real) be declared VOID. Because I currently
> don't
> see how I can continue in this RPG when I'm not
> given
> a fair chance to reply.
>
